item.title: MAKE win at the 7th China Academy Awards of Documentary Film
item.dc:creator: makeproductions
item.description:
Amazing to win against stiff competition. Congratulations to HBO Asia MAKE for winning Best Foreign Documentary Chinese Academy Awards of Documentary, the Chinese Oscars. The Talwars: Behind Closed Doors has won the Best Foreign Documentary Award at the 7th China Academy Awards of Documentary Film (CAADF). CAADF is China state-level academic award of documentary films.

The post MAKE win at the 7th China Academy Awards of Documentary Film appeared first on MAKE Productions.
item.content:encoded:
Amazing to win against stiff competition. Congratulations to HBO Asia MAKE for winning Best Foreign Documentary Chinese Academy Awards of Documentary, the Chinese Oscars.

The Talwars: Behind Closed Doors has won the Best Foreign Documentary Award at the 7th China Academy Awards of Documentary Film (CAADF).

CAADF is China state-level academic award of documentary films. CAADF is supervised by SARFT, and hosted by China Documentary Research Centre (CRDC) of Communication University of China (CUC). First launched in 2011, CAADF is known as “The Oscar of China Documentary” due to its rigorous academic integrity, professional standards and international perspective.

This year, the jury members include Jacques Perrin, director of award winning documentaries such as Winged Migration (Le Peuple Migrateur) , Oceans (Océans) and Seasons (Les saisons); He Suliu, professor, documentary director, and the vice dean of Journalism and Communication department of CUC; Gao Qunshu, the renowned director whose films including Beijing Blues, the winner of Best Picture at the 49th Taiwan Golden Horse Award; Zhong Danian, the former VP of Hong Kong based Phoenix Television; Anthony LaMolinara, the visual effect director of Spider-Man 1&2 and Liu Chun, former VP and COO of Sohu.com.

239 films have been selected to compete for 19 CAADF Awards, among which 5 films were nominated for Best Foreign Documentary Award. They are: Mosquito from Discovery Networks Asia-Pacific; Genius from National Geographic; Ancient Top 10 from A+E NETWORKS; American Dream from Andrey Ananin and The Talwars: Behind Closed Doors from HBO Asia (Winner).

The post MAKE win at the 7th China Academy Awards of Documentary Film appeared first on MAKE Productions.

item.title: 3 NOMINATIONS AT THE 2017 ASIAN TELEVISION AWARDS
item.dc:creator: makeproductions
item.description:
The list of nominees for the 2017 Asian Television Awards is out and we are pleased to announce that we have 3 nominations this year! Best Documentary Programme for Asian Century – Marcos – The Man and The Myth (Channel NewsAsia) Best Current Affairs Programme for Kidnapped (Channel NewsAsia) Best Social Awareness Programme for Undercover

The post 3 NOMINATIONS AT THE 2017 ASIAN TELEVISION AWARDS appeared first on MAKE Productions.
item.content:encoded:
The list of nominees for the 2017 Asian Television Awards is out and we are pleased to announce that we have 3 nominations this year!

  1. Best Documentary Programme for Asian Century – Marcos – The Man and The Myth (Channel NewsAsia)
  2. Best Current Affairs Programme for Kidnapped (Channel NewsAsia)
  3. Best Social Awareness Programme for Undercover Asia – In the Name of Honour (Channel NewsAsia)

A huge congratulations to all the teams involved in the making of these programmes

The post 3 NOMINATIONS AT THE 2017 ASIAN TELEVISION AWARDS appeared first on MAKE Productions.

item.title: MAKE’s first ever Head of Content and Development
item.dc:creator: makeproductions
item.description:
Emmy-award winning Producer/Director Brad Cox, is joining MAKE Singapore as our first ever Head of Content and Development. We are thrilled to have attracted such incredible talent. item.title: MAKE’s exclusive 4-part series, The Talwars: Behind Closed Doors
item.dc:creator: makeproductions
item.description:
MAKE is thrilled to share the trailer for our new 4-part series on HBO Asia and Star TV India. This is HBO Asia’s first factual commission and first true crime original. Premieres on Sunday 9pm 26th November 2017 – every week for 4 weeks.  

The post MAKE’s exclusive 4-part series, The Talwars: Behind Closed Doors appeared first on MAKE Productions.
item.content:encoded:
MAKE is thrilled to share the trailer for our new 4-part series on HBO Asia and Star TV India. This is HBO Asia’s first factual commission and first true crime original. Premieres on Sunday 9pm 26th November 2017 – every week for 4 weeks.

item.title: Trailer of The Great Green Wall
item.dc:creator: makeproductions
item.description:
We are excited to be sharing the trailer to our Feature Documentary, The Great Green Wall. The star of the show is singer, songwriter, activist, Inna Modja. This was filmed from our recce in June 2017, and we hope to have the main feature completed 2018. Check out the trailer here: https://vimeo.com/232070475

The post Trailer of The Great Green Wall appeared first on MAKE Productions.

item.title: The Great Green Wall on BBC Newsnight
item.dc:creator: makeproductions
item.description:
A preview of our forthcoming feature documentary on the African Great Green Wall was recently broadcast on BBC Newsnight. This documentary that is executive produced by Oscar nominated director, Fernando Meirelles, tells the exceptional story of a pan-African initiative, the Great Green Wall, which aims to improve livelihoods in the Sahel region, reverse desertification, and break the cycle

The post The Great Green Wall on BBC Newsnight appeared first on MAKE Productions.
item.content:encoded:
A preview of our forthcoming feature documentary on the African Great Green Wall was recently broadcast on BBC Newsnight. This documentary that is executive produced by Oscar nominated director, Fernando Meirelles, tells the exceptional story of a pan-African initiative, the Great Green Wall, which aims to improve livelihoods in the Sahel region, reverse desertification, and break the cycle of exodus.

The segment of BBC Newsnight can be watched here: The Great Green Wall of Africa: Will it help fight climate change? BBC Newsnight

The post The Great Green Wall on BBC Newsnight appeared first on MAKE Productions.
